post_content:
Please join us at the 2019 Prep the Town in Avondale and Evanston!

This summer, we will be painting 26 houses in both Avondale and Evanston as part of Paint the Town, our largest event of the year! But before we can paint… we have to prep. All 26 houses need to be scraped, primed, and powerwashed so that we can hit the ground running on the big day. 

If you provide a little love, we will provide a light breakfast, lunch, and all the tools you need to get the job done. Registration is below; sign up today!

Join us on Saturday, June 8th for Paint the Town! Approximately 750 volunteers will paint the exterior of 26 owner-occupied homes in Avondale and Evanston for those who are physically and/or financially unable to do the work themselves. Can’t spend the entire day with us? Not interested in painting? No problem! We are looking for volunteers throughout the day for tasks such as serving breakfast and lunch, parking direction, volunteer check-in, lunch delivery, etc. If you are over the age of 18, you can register via this page. We do have opportunities for volunteers age 10-17, but you’ll need to contact Chelsea Brown, Volunteer Coordinator at chelsea.brown@givebackcincinnati.org to register. There will be no online registration for minors. You will receive more information via email closer to the date. If you have any questions, please contact Chelsea Brown, Volunteer Coordinator at chelsea.brown@givebackcincinnati.org

Join us on Saturday, June 8th for Paint the Town! Approximately 750 volunteers will paint the exterior of 26 owner-occupied homes in Avondale and Evanston for those who are physically and/or financially unable to do the work themselves. More details, FAQs and registration below. After-party to follow event FAQs: What if I don’t have a “team” to paint on? No problem! Please select “General Volunteer” from the Team dropdown menu. We will find a house for you. What should I wear?
  1. You will be given a volunteer t-shirt upon check in, but otherwise you should wear clothes you don’t mind getting paint on.
  2. Close toed shoes, no sandals or flip-flops
  3. Hat!
What about breakfast and lunch? A grab-and-go breakfast (with coffee!!) will be available during check-in/registration. Lunch will be delivered to your house. Houses will also will have snacks and water. We will also have pizza available at the after-party. Vegetarian options are available, but if you have any other dietary needs or restrictions, please plan to bring your own food. What should I bring with me?
  1. Reusable water bottle
  2. Sunscreen
  3. Hat
  4. Driver’s License (You will need this for a beer at the After Party!)
Where should I park? Volunteers will park at Walnut Hills High School, assemble in their teams and then board busses to their houses. We will email you the meeting location’s address and specific parking instructions the week of the event. Can I volunteer for only a partial day? Yes and no. Painting a house requires a full day commitment. If you are unable to paint for a full day, we have non-painting volunteer roles with various time commitments throughout the day. Please email chelsea.brown@givebackcincinnati.org for more information. Can my relative/friend that is under 18 volunteer with me? No, all painting volunteers must be at least 18 years old. There are some non-painting volunteer roles suitable for a volunteer under 18 if they have a parent or legal guardian with them.

Help us celebrate the Fourth! We are excited to be participating in this year’s Northside 4th of July Parade, and are looking for volunteers to join our parade ensemble. 😎

Volunteers will represent Give Back Cincinnati throughout the duration of the parade and pass out GBC swag to spectators along the route. A GBC tank top will be available for volunteers while supplies last. More info about parade day below! 

PARKING FOR NON-PARADE VEHICLES:

Parking is unavailable for vehicles that aren’t IN the parade at the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church; all non-parade vehicles will need to park at the McKie Recreation Center (1655 Chase Ave) and shuttle over to the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church (4781 Hamilton Ave). The shuttle runs 9:30AM until 11:30AM. 
STAGING LOT SET UP:

When you arrive at the Greater Bethlehem Temple Church’s parking lot, you will want to find Give Back Cincinnati in section RED. Our exact parade number is 78. If you have difficulties in locating us, please find a Northside 4th of July Parade volunteer and inform them that you are looking for RED 78.
OTHER DETAILS:

We will supply all volunteers with GBC tank tops to wear during the parade; however, please feel free to get festive with your accessories.
GBC volunteers will either be handing out bottle open keychains to the crowd (do not throw, be sure to hand items to the crowd), waving flags, carrying our banner, squirting water guns, blowing bubbles, or whatever other crazy things we bring along with us. This event is all about having some fun so be ready to have a blast! J
Water, sunscreen and bug-spray will be available to all volunteers in our float.
There is a port-o-let behind the shuttle pick-up, and two near the staging lot, but that’s it. Be prepared.
PARADE END:

Celebrate a successful parade at the Northside Rock ‘n Roll Carnival at Hoffner Park. All GBC volunteers who participated in the parade will receive a beer on us!

 

From the Northside 4th of July Parade Facebook event:

Parade steps off at noon on Thursday, July 4th 2019. The parade starts at the northern boundary of Northside at Hamilton Avenue and Ashtree Drive and travels south on Hamilton Avenue to Hoffner Park. Roads will close approximately 10 minutes before parade start.

The mission of the Northside Fourth of July Parade is to celebrate independence and to serve as a tool for community building. Parade organizers work to invite and involve people from all corners of the community as both participants and viewers. The parade offers a way to get to know one’s neighbors through a shared light-hearted activity. Neighbors who know one another and have laughed together are more inclined to be involved and to make their neighborhood a nicer place to live. We invite everyone to join us and help celebrate the Fourth of July!

Are you interested in volunteering with Give Back Cincinnati? Come on down to Higher Gravity Crafthaus (Northside) and enjoy a free, exclusive brewery presentation and flight tasting, all while meeting and socializing with other volunteers around Cincinnati!
 
P.S. Existing members welcome 🙂

Final Event Details: Thank you to everyone who will volunteer with us tomorrow. We will be cleaning up the waterway along Winton Woods Harbor at Winton Woods Park. Event Agenda: 8:30am - 9:00am: Check-in and registration at the boat house. 9:00am - 12:00pm: Event kickoff and cleaning up trash along the Winton Woods Harbor waterway. 12:00pm: Return to dock. Event wrap up. 12:30'ish: After party at Fibonacci Brewing Company. Exact time depending on when we're all wrapped up. We'll head to Fibonacci after we're finished.
Address: Winton Woods 10245 Winton Road Springfield Township, Ohio 45231 Parking: Winton Woods is providing free parking for all volunteers. Please inform the employee working at the welcome booth that you're there to volunteer at the Don't Rock the Boat event, and they will let you in for no charge. You may park anywhere near the harbor. Be Prepared! Tomorrow will be a beautiful sunny day, so please apply sunscreen. Come dressed for being in hot weather. In the unlikely event that you end up in the water, we recommend that you come dressed in clothes you won't mind getting wet and that you lock valuables like your phone, wallet, purse, etc. in your car. Remember to stay hydrated throughout the day! After Party: Our after party will be hosted at Fibonacci Brewing Company, which is about a 10 minute drive from Winton Woods Park. As a thank you to our awesome volunteers, Give Back Cincinnati will buy everyone's first beer and provide lunch. Fibonacci Address: 1445 Compton Rd Cincinnati OH 45231 Parking at Fibonacci: Fibonacci has very limited parking on their property. However, there is ample parking along the street. Just be aware to avoid parking in front of No Parking signs and Bus Stops (there may be busy stops that just have a sign and no bench). Thank you to Budget Dumpster for sponsoring this event. We're looking forward to volunteering with you tomorrow! ________________________________________________________________________________________

Volunteer with us for our annual waterway clean-up event: Don’t Rock the Boat, sponsored by Budget Dumpster! On Saturday, August 10, we will take to the water to clean it up by boat. This is the perfect opportunity to enjoy Cincinnati’s outdoors, give back to the environment and meet new volunteers!

Be prepared to get dirty! We recommend long pants; long-sleeved shirts, boots or sturdy, closed-toe shoes (no sandals); work gloves to protect against scratches, insects, sunscreen, etc.; and rain gear if the sky doesn’t think we have enough water. All clean-up supplies, canoes, oars and life vests will be provided to volunteers.

Check-in and breakfast will take place from 8:30 a.m. to 8:59 a.m., and we will hit the water at 9! After a good morning’s work, we’ll cool down with a happy hour at a nearby watering hole (location TBD). The first round and appetizers are on us!

We are extremely grateful for Budget Dumpster sponsoring this event. Budget Dumpster is a dumpster rental service providing low-cost and effective waste removal solutions in over 150 cities across the country, including Cincinnati! Learn more about their services and community outreach at www.budgetdumpster.com/cincinnati-oh-dumpster-rental-ohio.php.

Get more in touch with your community and build your leadership skills with Cincy YP's next event in their Community Stories series: Inclusive Leadership! At this event, Cincy YP hopes to engage YPs from across the tristate to get involved in their communities through volunteerism, build their inclusion and diversity leadership skills through service learning, and help all gain a better understanding of those who make up/form the vibrant culture within their community. Cincy YP is also in need of three more volunteer speakers to share their community story! Have a story to tell? Email Renika Smiley at info@cincyyp.org for more information.

Join us for an art-themed scavenger hunt around downtown Cincinnati, starting in the heart of OTR!

Attendees must decipher clues that will take them on a tour around downtown Cincinnati that showcases the artsy side of our city. Attendees can sign up as a team of 2-4 people or arrive as individuals that will be assigned a team upon arrival. The last destination for all participants will be at Oddfellows (2014 Elm St, Cincinnati, OH 45202) for an after party!

Registration will take place from 1:30 p.m. - 1:45 p.m.

12th Street Shuffle

The Pub Crawl With a Community Twist

12 Bars Along 12th Street & 4 Breweries - Supporting Give Back Cincinnati

Experience the awesome bars and restaurants around the 12th Street area from Pendleton through OTR while supporting volunteerism in Cincinnati! The second annual 12th Street Shuffle is hosted by some of your favorite breweries and bars to benefit Give Back Cincinnati, an all-volunteer led nonprofit organization that engages thousands of volunteers to uplift Greater Cincinnati's communities at over two dozen community service projects each year. You and your friends will enjoy $4 drink specials for beers by 3 Points Urban Brewery, MadTree Brewing, West Side Brewing, and Streetside Brewery at the participating bars. You'll also get a chance to win some cool raffle prizes.
Registration:  Tickets are $12 each with proceeds benefiting Give Back Cincinnati. You'll get a 12th Street Shuffle commemorative beer mug, $4 drink specials for beers from the featured breweries, your first drink at 3 Points Urban Brewery, and a raffle entry.

Register Here on Eventbrite 

Online ticket sales close on Friday night, September 6th. Tickets will be sold in-person at registration at 3 Points Urban Brewery as well.
Details: Date:  Saturday, September 7, 2019 Time:  12:00pm - 7:00pm. Check-in opens at 11:00am. Location:  3 Points Urban Brewery Pub crawl route is along 12th Street from Pendleton through OTR.
Raffle Items: One night stay at 21c Museum Hotel $250 gift card to Richter & Phillips Two tickets on the 42-yard line to the Cincinnati Bengals vs. Jacksonville Jaguars home game on Sunday, October 20th One-year standard membership to the Cincinnati Zoo Four admission tickets, four ride tickets, and a parking pass to the Cincinnati Zoo
Participating Bars 
  • 3 Points Urban Brewery
  • Nation Kitchen and Bar
  • Boomtown Biscuits & Whiskey
  • Lucius Q
  • Rosedale
  • Treehouse Patio Bar
  • Rhinehaus
  • HalfCut
  • The Drinkery
  • Aladdin's Eatery
  • Wiseguy Lounge
  • Cobblestone OTR
Featured Breweries
  • 3 Points Urban Brewery
  • Streetside Brewery
  • West Side Brewing
  • MadTree Brewing
MUST BE AGE 21+ TO PARTICIPATE

We are partnering with the Girl Scouts of Western Ohio to provide a fun day of outdoor games at Sharon Woods (Fern Hallow) for some girls scouts in the area! Volunteers will help lead teams through different "field day" activities (including Tag, Tug of War, Turtle Soccer and more!) or help manage some of the activities themselves. It will be a day of competition and good sportsmanship for all involved! All activity supplies and lunch will be provided. We will celebrate the success of the 2019 Kids Olympics games at an after-party happy hour at Envision Cinemas Bar & Grill (4780 Cornell Rd, Blue Ash, OH 45241), and the first round will be on us! FINAL EVENT DETAILS: Date: Saturday, September 13th Time: 10:00am - 2:00pm. Registration opens at 10am. The games begin close to 11am. Location: Sharon Woods - Fern Hollow | 11450 Lebanon Road | Sharonville, OH 45241
Arrival: At the front gate, volunteers must say they are here supporting the "GS Volunteer Event" or "Field Day Event." Following the event, join us for an after party at Envision Cinemas Blue Ash, 4780 Cornell Rd, Blue Ash, OH 45241 (bar only). The first round is on us!

We invite you to attend our 2019 leadership info session at 6 p.m. Tuesday, September 17, for a refresh on the mission/vision of Give Back Cincinnati, a discussion of what the organization means to some of our current leadership team and a fireside chat about our open 2020 leadership roles. We have a variety of openings, including everything from committee member roles to executive board positions! Open Opportunities: 
  • VP - Operations
  • VP - Finance
  • Communications Director
  • Membership Director
  • Development Director
  • Strategic Improvements Director
  • Technology Director
  • Interactive Events Chair
  • Advisory Board Member
  • Committee Member Roles on various event, program, and executive board committees
Apply for a leadership role here!

Give Back Cincinnati Leadership Applications & Interviews

Applications are open for our available 2020 leadership roles! Whether it's joining our Executive Board, leading Interactive events, or joining a committee, there's plenty of opportunities if you'd like to get more involved with our leadership. Read through our Leadership Info Session Slides to learn more about Give Back Cincinnati, leadership in our organization, and available leadership opportunities for 2020. Open Leadership Opportunities: 
  • VP - Operations
  • VP - Finance
  • Communications Director
  • Membership Director
  • Development Director
  • Strategic Improvements Director
  • Technology Director
  • Interactive Events Chair
  • Advisory Board Member
  • Committee member with our event, program, and executive committees
Apply for a leadership role here! Leadership Interviews Some positions will require an interview. If you apply for one of those positions, please sign up for an interview on our website for one of the available time slots on either September 22 or September 28.  If you have any questions/concerns about our leadership selection process or can't make either of the two scheduled weekends, please email Patrick at patrick.newton@givebackcincinnati.org. Location: Cincinnati Cares office on 1776 Mentor Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45212. The office is in the building on the right-hand side when you turn onto Mentor Ave. When you arrive, the doors to the building will likely be locked.  Text (513) 236-5676, and someone will come downstairs to let you in as soon as possible. Parking: Plenty of street parking available on Mentor Ave right outside the office building.

The second-annual CincySwap event is a free clothing exchange to help the community tap into the incredible fashion sense of our Queen City peers! This is a 21+ event.
 
So, how do you get involved? Those interested in the Swap can either bring their clothing donations to the event venue (The Woodward Theater) or drop them off prior to the event during one of our pre-event collection dates at MadTree Taproom!
 
Racks of clothing will be set up throughout Woodward, and a cash bar will be available throughout the day. We are also happy to bring back DJ LPete to keep the music flowing throughout the event!
 
Items accepted: clothing, shoes and accessories of all shapes and sizes. Goodwill will collect any surplus of clothing following the event.
----------------------
We are in need of volunteers to help staff the event starting at Noon! On the day of the event, volunteers will help with set up and tear down, keeping clothing racks stocked with new donations, and clothing checkout. Interested? Fill out the second form below!

In partnership between Cincy YP and Fuel Cincinnati, we invite you to attend the first-ever Social Innovator $3,000 Pitch Contest, celebrating Impact + Innovation in our community with a performance by Cincinnati Music Accelerator Alumni’s. During this interactive event, Cincy YP and Fuel Cincinnati seek to recognize and support innovative nonprofit ideas working to solve critical issues facing marginalized and under-resourced communities across Cincinnati. Through various presentations, the Social Innovator Pitch Contest will showcase organizations on the forefront of change--each pitching their unique ideas for a grant prize of $3,000. That's where you come in! Each member of the audience will have the opportunity to vote for their favorite idea, narrowing the competition down to the final three contestants. Schedule:
  • 5:00 - 6:30 p.m. - Cocktail Hour
  • 6:30 - 8:00 p.m. - Pitch Contest
Cincy YP and Fuel Cincinnati are both programs of Give Back Cincinnati.

On Saturday, October 26, Give Back Cincinnati is partnering with Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center's Champions program for a Halloween-themed event. With a spooky carnival atmosphere, volunteers will interact with CCHMC’s Champions program through a variety of activities, including movies, games, pumpkin painting and more! Volunteers are encouraged to wear costumes (family- and kid-friendly)! Cincinnati Children's is a latex-free facility, so we ask that you please check to make sure your costume and costume makeup do not have any latex in it before volunteering.

Join us on Saturday, November 2, for our fourth Hands-On event of the year, Happy Trails!
 
Volunteers will group up at Gorman Heritage Farm to help beautify and widen a path for a corn maze; remove invasive plant species; and clean up at the end of the event. Please plan to get down and dirty! Volunteers should, at a minimum wear pants; we also recommend long sleeves. Gloves and tools will be provided.
 
After the event, we’ll head over to a local watering hole for a GBC Happy Hour!

The Cincinnati Poverty Simulation challenges participants to take a walk in the shoes of our neighbors in need--to explore poverty experientially. The objective of this event is to help people better understand the realities of living in poverty, to grow in solidarity and to take action on behalf of community neighbors in need. Staff at St Vincent DePaul Oznam Center for Service Learning will help facilitate this experience, as well as provide a debrief of the experience after completion.

Kitchen Prep Serving a turkey and dressings holiday meal takes a lot of preparation. We would love help doing all things food such as chopping veggies, mixing mashed potatoes, turkey and pie fun.   Pre-Event Preparation Have plans with the family on the holiday, but love Fall Feast and want to help us out? It’s a sorting, decorating, bag stuffing party at our convention center!  Join us as we transform, organize, and set up all things Thanksgiving.  Volunteer time:  Check in 3:30 - 4pm Volunteer Hours: 4 – 8pm
Kitchen Prep Serving a turkey and dressings holiday meal takes a lot of preparation. We would love help doing all things food such as chopping veggies, mixing mashed potatoes, turkey and pie fun.

Kitchen (Over 18 age): Feeding our community takes many hands.  Please join our kitchen family in tasks such as serving lines, preparing appetizers, pie cutting, and cleaning dishes.   Volunteer time:  Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting: 945am  Volunteer Hours: 10am to 2:30pm   Kitchen Clean Up Crew (over 18 age): Very important task helping us behind the scenes keeping those yummy holiday meals flowing by organizing, and cleaning our cooking supplies. 2 Shifts: 1st Shift Volunteer time:  Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting: 945am  Volunteer Hours: 10am to 1pm  2nd Shift Volunteer time:  Check in 11 - 1130am Team meeting: 1145am  Volunteer Hours: 12p to 3p    Kids Zone (Over 14 age): Bring out that kid in you by helping us create a fun and SAFE environment for our younger guests.  We have incredible games, crafts, and blow up adventures. Volunteer time: Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting: 945am Volunteer Hours: 10-230pm (help clean up)   Beverage and Bussers (over 18 age):   Drinks anyone?  Help us create a friendly environment for our guests by fulfilling drink requests, and “tidying up” the space as guests finish their meal. Volunteer time: Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting 945am Volunteer Hours: 10am-230pm (help clean up)   Servers (Over 18 age):  Give our guests that “cared for” holiday spirit by serving our fabulous turkey and fixings meal to each one. Volunteer time: Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting: 945am Volunteer Hours: 10am-230pm (help clean up)   Hostess/Host (Over 18 age): Greet our guests with your fabulous smile, and help us maximize our open seating throughout the event. Volunteer time: Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting 945am Volunteer Hours: 10am-230pm (help clean up)   Share A Meal: How about those Bengals?  Love to relax and enjoy a meal and conversation with someone?  This family friendly position allows you to spend the holiday meal engaging with our guests and enjoying each other’s company. Volunteer time: Check in 9 – 930am Team meeting 945am Volunteer Hours: 10am-230pm (help clean up)   Clean Up Party: We couldn’t have such a complete event without our amazing Clean Up Crew.  Love to give back, but can’t make our 10am - 2pm event?  This is a family friendly time helping us “tidy up”.  Tasks include breaking down each space such as Health Zone, Hair Salon, Coat Shop, decorations, tables, vacuuming, and overall returning the convention center to order. Volunteer time:  Check in 1 - 1:30pm Team meeting: 1:45 Volunteer: 2 – 4:30p   Volunteer Registration (Over 18 age): Love to brighten someone’s day?  Please help us check-in our wonderful volunteers. Volunteer time:  Check in: 7 – 7:30am Team meeting:  7:30am Volunteer hours: 745am – 1:30pm   Kitchen – Fall Feast to go (Over 18 age): We can’t get enough of loving on our city, not only do we prepare a wonderful holiday meal for our guests at Duke Energy Convention Center, but we also team up with local organizations to provide meals for our community neighbors.  Volunteer time:  Check in 730 - 745am Volunteer hours:  8am – 12pm   Coat Shop (Over 18 age): Bring that warmth and love to our guests by helping us provide a winter coat, gloves, hats, scarves.  Each guest receives a guided shopping experience to help him or her find the perfect coat.  We also need volunteers to keep our space organized and refilled as our day progresses.   Volunteer time:  Check in 8 – 8:30am Team meeting: 845am Volunteer hours: 9am – 2pm   Social Ambassadors (Over 18 age): Love to interact with folks, and help them find their way around?  Enjoy getting your steps in while engaging with our guests to greet them, and guide them throughout areas such as Health Zone, Hair Salon, Coat Shop, and Grand Ballroom.   Volunteer time:  Check in 8 – 8:30am Team meeting 845am Volunteer hours: 9a – 2pm   Guest Registration (Over 18 age): The spirit of the holiday shines through as we greet, and check our guests in.  Other activities include helping our guests with wristbands that match services such as coats, hair and health zones. Volunteer time:  Check in 8 – 8:30am Team meeting: 845am Volunteer hours: 9am – 1:30pm

To celebrate Give Back Cincinnati's soon-to-be 20th Anniversary and to ring in the year 2020, we're putting on a 1920s Gatsby Party at the 20th Century Theater!
 
This event is a shout out to everyone we've partnered with and to each of our volunteers. We are continuously grateful for your support in furthering our mission to build today's communities and tomorrow's leaders. You truly make the Greater Cincinnati area feel like home! Now...let's party like it's 1920!
 
This is a 21+ event. Please bring a valid ID to enter. Admission is FREE, and your first round is on us.

Looking to capitalize on those new year resolutions, get more involved in your community, and meet some friendly faces along the way? If so, Give Back Cincinnati is the place for you!

Join us January 11th to kick off our 20th anniversary year and learn more about our mission, upcoming volunteer opportunities, and the volunteers that make it all possible. We'll have food, bowling, and as always the first round of drinks is on us. See you there!

INFORMATION

We are partnering with the Cincinnati Tool Bank and Alpine Water to help revitalize a local school in the area! Volunteers will help paint classrooms, murals, and build/paint mural benches. All supplies will be provided. Following the event, join us for an after party at Veracruz Mexican Grill (3108 Price Ave, Cincinnati, OH 45205). The first round is on us!

This event made possible by Cincinnati ToolBank and Alpine Water.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, January 18th Time: 8:30am - 1:30pm Location: Roberts Paideia Academy 1702 Grand Ave Cincinnati, OH 45214

INFORMATION

Join us for our annual "Young at Heart" service event at St. Paul Village in Madisonville! This is the first event of 2020 from our Interactive series, which focuses meaningful interactions with members of our community. We will spend the afternoon hosting games and engaging activities with the senior residents of St. Paul Village.
"Don't you know that it's worth every treasure on earth to be young at heart?" ~ Frank Sinatra
Following the event, join us for an after party at Bad Tom Smith Brewing (5900 Madison Rd, Cincinnati, OH 45227). The first round is on us!

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, February 8th Time: 12:30pm - 3:30pm Location: St. Paul Village 5515 Madison Rd Cincinnati, OH 45227

INFORMATION

Join us for a look into Cincinnati's history. We will walk through our Native American history, historical shifts in population, Over-The-Rhine People's Movement, and the struggles of people in Over-the-Rhine over time. Topics such as hostile design, displacement, and gentrification will be covered while also uncovering ways in which neighbors have come together to fight for their rights and security, win or lose. It will be an eye-opening tour that helps people understand the root causes of poverty and homelessness in Cincinnati, and ways in which they can get involved on a personal and structural level. Afterwards, join us at Venice on Vine (1301 Vine Street, Cincinnati, OH 45202). The first round is on us!

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, February 29th Time: 10:00am - 1:00pm Location: Greater Cincinnati Homeless Coalition 117 East 12th Street Cincinnati, OH 45202

INFORMATION

Join us for fowling, a.k.a. football-bowling (think football, bowling, and cornhole all rolled into one)! Lanes officially open at 7pm, but come early for drinks and a rules explanation, and stay to learn about Give Back Cincinnati and make some new friends!

DETAILS

Date: Thursday, March 19th Time: 6:30pm - 9:00pm Location: Fowling Warehouse Cincinnati 2940 Highland Ave #230 Cincinnati, OH 45212

Presented by Give Back Cincinnati, Local 12, and MadTree Brewing!

INFORMATION

**NO RSVP NEEDED* Come party on the square for the Cincinnati Reds' biggest day of the year! Watch the parade, cheer on the Reds, and enjoy a MadTree beer (or two) - beer sales benefit Give Back Cincinnati! DJ Diamond will be supplying the beats, and when you get hungry from all the cheering you can grab a bite from Skyline, Freddy's, or Big G BBQ. Thanks to all the sponsors that helped to make it possible: Skyline Chili Big G's Barbecue Freddy's EverDry Waterproofing

DETAILS

Date: Thursday, March 26th Time: 10:00am - 4:00pm Location: Fountain Square

INFORMATION

Though we've hunkered down and socially distanced, Give Back Cincinnati still wants to help connect the local Cincinnati community! Join us for a at-home happy hour and play some JackBox games - fun party games you can play just using your smartphone. Just sign up below and we will add you to a group for a random game. You'll receive an email from your "game host" (a Give Back board member) with a Zoom virtual meeting link and further details. That's it! If you'd like get setup ahead of time, you can download Zoom from their site: https://zoom.us

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, April 4th Time: 7:00pm - 9:00pm Location: Virtual (Zoom)

INFORMATION

Join us for a cultural scavenger hunt through Northern Kentucky using public transportation! Participants will decipher clues that will take them on a tour around Northern Kentucky that showcases the art, music, and culture found south of the Ohio River. The catch is that no private vehicle usage will be allowed to get from place to place, participants can use any other method of transportation from bus, scooter, bike, carshare service, or foot. Attendees can participate as a team of 3-5 people or arrive as individuals that will be assigned a team upon arrival. We will start and end at Wooden Cask Brewing where there will be plenty of free parking, an after party, and prizes for the winning teams!

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, April 18th Time: 2:00pm - 5:00pm Location: Wooden Cask Brewery 629 York Street Newport, KY 41071

INFORMATION

Break the quarantine blues with Give Back Cincinnati's virtual game night! We'll be playing Secret Hitler, Codenames, Fibbage, Quiplash, and more. All games will be held online over Zoom virtual meetings, so please make sure you have a computer readily available. Just sign up below and we will add you to a group for a random game. You'll receive an email from your "game host" (a Give Back board member) with a Zoom virtual meeting link and further details. That's it! If you'd like get setup ahead of time, you can download Zoom from their site: https://zoom.us

DETAILS

Date: Wednesday, April 29th Time: 7:00pm - 9:00pm Location: Virtual (Zoom)

INFORMATION

Break the quarantine blues with Give Back Cincinnati's virtual game night! We'll be playing Secret Hitler, Codenames, Fibbage, Quiplash, and more. All games will be held online over Zoom virtual meetings, so please make sure you have a computer readily available. Just sign up below and we will add you to a group for a random game. You'll receive an email from your "game host" (a Give Back board member) with a Zoom virtual meeting link and further details. That's it! If you'd like get setup ahead of time, you can download Zoom from their site: https://zoom.us

DETAILS

Date: Wednesday, May 13th Time: 7:00pm - 9:00pm (we'll begin playing around 7:20pm) Location: Virtual (Zoom)

JOIN THE LIVESTREAM HERE



INFORMATION

Give Back Cincinnati has been a proud member of Greater Cincinnati for more than 20 years. We’re frustrated and outraged by the wrongful deaths of George Floyd, Ahmaud Aubrey, Breonna Taylor and the many others. Give Back Cincinnati has been and will continue to be committed to serving our diverse and inclusive membership. We stand together with our brothers and sisters in the Black community to help create the world in which we want to live. We can do better. We will do better. We need to do better. Simply stating that we reject racism and discrimination isn’t enough. This conversation is meant to educate community members and be a part of starting the tough conversations with ourselves and each other. Together we can make Cincinnati a better place, for everyone.  The questions have been chosen from registrants who RSVP'ed before 6/10.
Our Panelists:
Council Member Jan-Michele Kearney
Cam Hardy
Means Cameron
Sgt. Anthony Mitchell
Ginger Bock
 
Moderated by:
Evan Millward



DETAILS

Date: Thursday, June 11th Time: 6:30pm - 8:00pm Location: Virtual (Zoom)


This event will be live-streamed, we will post that link here.

INFORMATION

Join Give Back Cincinnati along with Magnified Giving for a creative and fun way to learn about and make an impact for nonprofit organizations in our community! Now more than ever, nonprofits doing great work in Cincinnati are in need of financial support. This event will give you an opportunity to show the work and mission of one of your favorite nonprofits in order to earn them a monetary prize through a “giving circle.” Participants present for 2 to 3 minutes on any local non-profit and social cause they choose. Each participant will advocate for an agency and then the group will vote on which agency receives the grant.

DETAILS

Date: Thursday, June 25th Time: 6:30pm - 9:00pm Location: Virtual (Zoom) Rules and Guidelines:
  • Please come prepared to speak on a Zoom video call (no additional visuals) for 3 minutes max on a specific nonprofit agency that could be awarded a grant. Your pitch should include a brief overview of the work of the nonprofit and their impact in the community.
  • Only one person may sign up per nonprofit. You must list which agency you will be pitching for when registering and may be asked to pick an alternative if your nonprofit is already chosen.
  • All participants who make a pitch will get to vote on the winner at the end, and there will be prizes for 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place, which will be awarded directly to the agency.

Information

This 3 part series is a caucus for people who want to become anti-racist, anti-supremacist allies and examine their own ideas about race and racism. Our goal is to develop awareness, knowledge, and skills that will enable us to work in solidarity with others towards racial justice in our broader community. The Aspiring Anti-Racist Allies series will aim to critically explore historical and systemic constructions of whiteness as they relate to systemic racism, identify manifestations of white privilege and racism in our everyday lives, shift focus from individual instances of white privilege and racism to broader systemic understandings of white supremacy, and develop a critical, antiracist white identity, in order to effectively take action for racial justice. The 3 sessions will be comprised of the following themes:
  1. Creation of Whiteness and Socialization of Racism
  2. Why and how to have hard conversations about race as white people as well as the history and socialization of racism
    • White Identity Development
  3. Confronting white fragility and unpacking white privilege
    • Allyship, Advocacy, and Taking Action
  4. What does it mean to be an effective ally and where do we go from here
It is strongly encouraged, but not required, that participants attend all 3 sessions. Each session will be conducted in a “participatory workshop” style that will include watching short video clips as a group and discussing reactions, thoughts, and experiences with other self-identified white peers via zoom. There is no need to come to any of the sessions with anything pre-prepared, other than a willingness to share, listen, and learn.   Note: signing up for any one of this event series, you will receive the zoom information for all three sessions.

Information

INFORMATION

"Quaranteering" is a three-part series of events that will happen in small groups from September through November. Due to COVID-19 and the nature of precautions we need to take during this time, the series is meant to engage volunteers in outdoor events in which all precautions possible will be followed. Groups of no more than 10 people will engage in beautification activities throughout Cincinnati. This allows volunteers to continue to engage in the community and with one another while still keeping safety in mind. This event specifically is a three hour beautification project at Mt. Airy Forest in which two groups of less than 10 people (red and blue teams) will help take care of our beautiful land and ensure our community members can enjoy the space. Masks are required and will be provided. We will also provide a light breakfast and water. Thank you to Budget Dumpster for sponsoring this event!

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, September 12th Time: 9:00am - 12:00pm Location: Mt. Airy Forest
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Masks WILL be required at all times unless at least a 6 foot distance can be kept outdoors. Masks WILL be available. If a participant is not following this, they will be asked to leave by Give Back Exec/Hands-on Committee member.
  • A light breakfast will be provided.

INFORMATION

This event will be a socially-distant scavenger hunt spread across the four Great Parks locations selected for the October 10th Quaranteering event. The goal of the hunt is to explore each park and allow for socially-distant socializing. A list of scavenger hunt clues will be released on October 10th after the Quaranteering event. Participants are encouraged to hunt down clues in small groups and submit photographs of each location to the Social committee email address (social@givebackcincinnati.org). Prize winners will be randomly drawn from the teams that successfully guess the most clues. Note: Pictures may be shared on GBC social media.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, October 10th - Saturday, October 17th Time: 8:00am - 8:00pm Location: Shawnee Lookout, Fernbank Park, Winton Woods Harbor, Steamboat Bend Canoe/Kayak Launch at Woodland Mound

post_title: Quaranteering: Great Parks of Hamilton County
post_content:
INFORMATION

Give Back Cincinnati is excited to partner with the Great Parks of Hamilton County to beautify and de-pollute a wide variety of lands throughout the Cincinnati area. In a time of crisis, taking care of our environment and a shared safe place for our residents is pivotal to a better Cincinnati. Give Back Cincinnati feels that even though we as a community are social distancing and wearing masks with interactions to help stop the spread, it is our duty to help the community and care for the outdoor spaces around us. This event specifically is a three hour beautification project at multiple Great Parks in Hamilton County, in which separate groups of six people will help take care of our beautiful land and ensure our community members can enjoy the space. Masks are required and will be provided. We will also provide a light breakfast and water.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, October 10th Time: 9:00am - 12:00pm Location: Shawnee Lookout, Fernbank Park, Winton Woods Harbor, Steamboat Bend Canoe/Kayak Launch at Woodland Mound
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Masks WILL be required at all times unless at least a 6 foot distance can be kept outdoors. Masks WILL be available. If a participant is not following this, they will be asked to leave by Give Back Exec/Hands-on Committee member.
  • A light breakfast will be provided.

INFORMATION

In a time when national politics dominates the news, come learn about and discuss lesser known issues happening in our Greater Cincinnati area. There will be multiple rounds of 15 minute “speed conversations” with a small group about various topics. A brief article will be provided about each topic and you will get a chance to read and discuss reactions with your small group for the short time. Each topic will be different and no prior knowledge is necessary. This is a chance to learn something new, share your ideas, hear from others, and stay civically engaged while connecting with others in a safe way.

DETAILS

Date: Thursday, October 29th Time: 6:00pm - 7:30pm Location: Esoteric Brewing, 918 E McMillan St, Cincinnati OH 45206

INFORMATION

Give Back Cincinnati is excited to partner with the Gorman Heritage Farm to beautify and de-pollute the Cincinnati area. In a time of crisis, taking care of our environment and a shared safe place for our residents is pivotal to a better Cincinnati. Give Back Cincinnati feels that even though we as a community are social distancing and wearing masks with interactions to help stop the spread, it is our duty to help the community and care for the outdoor spaces around us. This event is a beautification project at Gorman Heritage Farm, in which four separate groups of seven people will help take care of our beautiful land and ensure our community members can enjoy the space. Masks are required and will be provided. We will also provide a light breakfast and water. A special waiver will be provided closer to the event to registered attendees, and it must be signed in order to participate.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, November 7th Time: 9:00am - 11:30am; 12:30pm - 2:30pm Location: Gorman Heritage Farm
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes long pants, closed toe shoes, hats, gloves, sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Masks WILL be required at all times unless at least a 6 foot distance can be kept outdoors. Masks WILL be available. If a participant is not following this, they will be asked to leave by Give Back Exec/Hands-on Committee member.
  • Park at the UAW lot on the left of the shared driveway.
  • Waiver must be signed in order to participate.
  • Group 1 (Gardening and/or Trail Maintenance): Herbicide will be used in trail maintenance for the removal of invasive honeysuckle. Gloves and a mask are required when using the applicator.

Give Back Cincinnati Leadership Applications & Interviews

Applications are open for our available 2021 leadership roles! Whether it's joining our Executive Board, leading Interactive events, or joining a committee, there's plenty of opportunities if you'd like to get more involved with our leadership. Read through our Leadership Info Session Slides to learn more about Give Back Cincinnati, leadership in our organization, and available leadership opportunities for 2021. Apply for a leadership role here! Leadership Interviews Some positions will require an interview. If you apply for one of those positions, please sign up for an interview on our website for one of the available time slots on either December 5 or December 12.  If you have any questions/concerns about our leadership selection process or can't make either of the two scheduled weekends, please email Patrick at patrick.newton@givebackcincinnati.org. Location: Zoom

Location: Zoom

INFORMATION

Give Back Cincinnati is partnering with John P. Parker School as part of Cincinnati Public Schools to update and renovate the Learning Garden at John P. Parker. This Learning Garden allows students to maximize their hands-on learning by having students actively participate in cultivating food from seed to table. This project not only promotes our community’s student learning, but it also supports the promotion of local and global sustainability, health and nutrition, and community. Come "Garden with Give Back" to renovate the Learning Garden through a wide variety of projects! COVID-19 safety considerations will be in place, including but not limited to requiring masks to be worn at all times.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, March 27 Time: 9:00am - 1 pm Location: Learning Garden at John P. Parker
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes long pants, closed toe shoes, hats, gloves, sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Masks WILL be required at all times unless at least a 6 foot distance can be kept outdoors. Masks WILL be available. If a participant is not following this, they will be asked to leave by Give Back Exec/Hands-on Committee member.

INFORMATION

Give Back Cincinnati is partnering with Cincinnati Parks and Northside Greenspace to remove invasive Honeysuckle at Badgley Run in Northside. Light breakfast will be provided. COVID-19 safety considerations will be in place, including but not limited to requiring masks to be worn at all times. Hosted with support by Alpine Valley Water and Coffee.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, May 22 Time: 9:00am - 12 pm Location: Badgley Run Park, 1926 Washburn St. Cincinnati, OH 45223
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes long pants, closed toe shoes, hats, gloves, sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Make sure to wear sunscreen, wear closed toed shoes, long pants, long sleeve shirt, and bring a water bottle.
  • Masks WILL be required at all times unless at least a 6 foot distance can be kept outdoors. Masks WILL be available. If a participant is not following this, they will be asked to leave by Give Back Exec/Hands-on Committee member.

Event Details: We are really excited for our first New Member event of the year! Get to know other new members, learn about Give Back Cincinnati and ask any questions that you have about our organization. Join us for a game of Fowling - is it football, is it bowling, is it cornhole, you don't know until you try it yourself! The lanes will open at 6 p.m. but do come early for drinks (on us) while you learn more about Give Back Cincinnati! Date: Thursday, June 10th Time: 5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m. Location: Fowling Warehouse Cincinnati 2940 Highland Ave #230 Cincinnati, OH 45212 You can learn more at https://fowlingwarehouse.com/cincinnati-oh/!

post_title: Pendleton Pick-Up: Neighborhood Clean Up with Give Back
post_content:
INFORMATION

Join Give Back Cincinnati for a day of trash pick-up and cleaning in Pendleton and Over-the-Rhine. We will be cleaning up trash in a neglected area of Pendleton and Over-the-Rhine on June 26. COVID-19 safety considerations will be in place. Thanks to our sponsor Alpine Water.

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, June 26 Time: 9:00am - 1 pm Location: Meet at Ziegler Park
  • Please dress for outdoor labor. This includes long pants, closed toe shoes, hats, gloves, sunscreen and bug spray.
  • Masks will be available.

INFORMATION

Rock the Boat is BACK! Give Back Cincinnati will be cleaning up the waterway along Winton Woods Harbor at Winton Woods Park. Event Agenda:
  • 8:30am - 9:00am: Check-in and registration at the boat house.
  • 9:00am - 12:00pm: Event kickoff and cleaning up trash along the Winton Woods Harbor waterway.
  • 12:00pm: Return to dock. Event wrap up.
Parking: Winton Woods is providing free parking for all volunteers. Please inform the employee working at the welcome booth that you're there to volunteer at the Don't Rock the Boat event, and they will let you in for no charge. You may park anywhere near the harbor. The event is sponsored by Alpine Water. Quick tips:
  • Be Prepared!
  • Apply sunscreen. Come dressed for being in hot weather.
  • In the unlikely event that you end up in the water, we recommend that you come dressed in clothes you won't mind getting wet and that you lock valuables like your phone, wallet, purse, etc. in your car.
  • Remember to stay hydrated throughout the day!
  • Masks will be available.
  • Note: Per Winton Woods regulations, unvaccinated guests are required to wear a mask to enter buildings and when outdoors and unable to consistently maintain a distance of 6 feet or more from individuals who are not members of their household. 

DETAILS

Date: Saturday, August 7, 2021 Time: 8:30 a.m.- 12:30 p.m. Location: Winton Woods Boat House: 10245 Winton Road, Cincinnati, OH 45231
